alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 10:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Randolph, north central Pocahontas, Taylor, eastern Lewis, east central Braxton, Upshur, northeastern Webster, Barbour and Harrison Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1028 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Salem to near Rock Cave to 8 miles west of Holly River State Park. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Elkins, Buckhannon, Grafton, Weston, Philippi, Audra State Park, Bridgeport, Belington, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Anmoore, Mill Creek, Jackson Mill, Dailey, Holly River State Park, Stonewall Jackson, Rock Cave and Beverly. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 91 and 127. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 66 and 82. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Braxton; Harrison; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Taylor; Upshur
